title: FRQ Score
stimulusHtml:
NOTE: On the AP Exam, to earn a point for a rubric row, responses will need to meet all criteria for that row.

Points earned:

+1 [Skill 3.B] The response includes a code segment that contains a student-developed procedure that implements an algorithm used in the program.

Do NOT award a point if:

● the procedure is a built-in or existing procedure or language structure, such as an event handler or main method, where the student only implements the body of the procedure rather than defining the name, return type (if applicable) and parameters.

+1 [Skill 3.B] The procedure contains and uses one or more parameters that have an effect on the functionality of the procedure.

+1 [Skill 4.C] The response describes two calls to the selected procedure, where each call passes different arguments that cause a different segment of code in the algorithm to execute.

Do NOT award a point if:

● the two calls cause the same segment of code in the algorithm to execute even if the result is different.

+1 [Skill 4.C] The response describes what condition(s) is being tested by each call to the procedure.

Do NOT award a point if:

● the response describes conditions being tested that are implausible, inaccurate, or inconsistent with the program.

+1 [Skill 3.B] The response identifies the result of each call.

Do NOT award a point if:

● the identified results of either call are implausible, inaccurate, or inconsistent with the program.
descriptions:
